name: Acute Anterior Uveitis
chief_complaint: My eye is red, painful, and sensitive to light
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, but recurrent episodes are common in HLA-B27 positive patients
description: Acute anterior uveitis is an inflammation of the iris and ciliary body, often associated with HLA-B27 related systemic diseases. It presents with acute onset of eye pain, redness, and photophobia. The condition requires prompt treatment to prevent complications like synechiae formation or glaucoma.
